analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the conditions in the law of conditionality
The section on the three kinds of states that are inferior, etc.

original: Nahīnaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā majjhimo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: na hīnam na kusalam dhammam paccayā majjhimaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha pe avigate cha
translated: With an inferior unprofitable state as condition there arises a medium profitable state, by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.) In the case of root-cause, there are six; … in the case of non-obstruction, there are six.

original: Nahīnaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā hīno akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na hīnam na akusalam dhammam paccayā hīnaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With an inferior unprofitable state as condition there arises an inferior unprofitable state, by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.) In the case of root-cause, there are three; … in the case of non-obstruction, there are three.

original: Nahīnaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca majjhimo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: na hīnam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca majjhimaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe avigate cha
translated: With an inferior indeterminate state as condition there arises a medium indeterminate state, by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.) In the case of root-cause, there are six; in the case of predominance, there are six; … in the case of non-obstruction, there are six.
